item.title: Are We at War with Venezuela?
item.description: Trump’s lethal strike on a ship ‘transporting illegal narcotics’ raises yet more questions.

item.title: RFK Jr. Is Compounding the CDC’s Covid Mistakes
item.description: The HHS secretary is substituting one set of unscientific, politically driven priorities for another.

item.title: Government by Emergency Is a Bad Idea
item.description: The presidency doesn’t need any more discretionary power.

item.title: Starmer’s Regime Just Lit The Fuse On The U.K.’s Free Speech Crisis
item.description: Popular Irish sitcom writer Graham Linehan was arrested in London Monday after expressing anti-transgender opinions on X.

item.title: Ban the Fear, Not the Freedom: Massachusetts Bill Misses the Mark on Nicotine
item.description: In a society of free, autonomous adults, banning nicotine because it offends one legislator’s sensibilities is simply unacceptable.

item.title: Our Two-Party System Isn’t Going Anywhere
item.description: Elon Musk’s America Party is the latest third-party dream to die.

item.title: The Biggest Hindrance To Confirming Trump’s Nominees Is John Thune
item.description: Thune and the Senate GOP have shown little to no appetite for doing what's necessary to get the president's nominees across the finish line.

item.title: Trump warns of sweeping damage if Supreme Court doesn't uphold his tariff power
item.description: President Trump said Wednesday the U.S. will "suffer greatly" if a court ruling against his tariff powers is allowed to stand.

item.title: Here Are Three Ways Americans Can Fight The U.K.’s Orwellian Attempts To Suppress Free Speech
item.description: The arrest of beloved comedian Graham Linehan for criticizing the transgender movement makes it clear that the U.K. is becoming a police state.
